page.title: 02RURAL RIDE (CONT)
page.content: Soon we were back in country lanes to Staverton village and yet it is so near the town. There were many very old buildings especially farms and churches. We will visit a few later. Then on to the hamlet of Barrow. We would like to have gone on to Uckington but this was on a very busy road and we thought it would not be safe to have so many cyclists on such a main road. We had met quite a bit of traffic even on the country roads we went on but the drivers were very considerate and gave us plenty of room. Our route covered some 12kms and we went through beautiful countryside with plenty of birds and butterflies. We passed many farms but we also saw the Dowty factories, the motor way, hotels, caravan sites, Hayden Sewage Farm, Park Nurseries and homes. These we would all look at closer.
